attributes.additional_details: The 4th plinth in trafalgar square lacks a permanent exhibit. We believe that a dead parrot statue should be placed there in recognition of Monty Python's pivotal contribution to British culture and its admiration throughout the world. We wish the government to enack whatever legislation is required to ensure this happens, and to allocate the required public funds either from taxation or public subscription. And remember to nail the parrot to the plinth, as it may just be pining...

rejection.details: This is the responsibility of the Mayor's office.
